Posts.Content: Hello Everyone, Please join us this Tuesday (April 2) night for our advanced cancer caregivers virtual support group at 5p Pacific time/8p Eastern time. If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have both lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. Answer Cancer's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 p.m. Eastern time (5p Pacific) on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month. The group is FREE & DROP-IN; join online or by telephone - you can find the instructions for joining at the end of the message. AnCan's caregiver meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! We hope to talk with you soon; please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org. We hope to talk with you soon! --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE Answer Cancer Meeting Room Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First time using GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 other national local access codes are available - please e-mail me. Access Code: 222-583-973 Answer Cancer Foundation is a Qualified 501(c)3 Tax Exempt Organization. Tax ID: 81-1588152. Address: Answer Cancer Foundation, 1104 Hawthorne Circle, Shakopee, MN 55379. NOTE: Answer Cancer Foundation does not provide medical advice and is not subject to HIPAA compliance as a peer-to-peer organization. We DO empower those seeking to use our programs and services to manage their own care.

Posts.Title: Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - Tuesday, May 7 at 5p PT

Posts.Content: From the patient/caregiver perspective, I think the constant stream of new and different people ("I'm the nurse until 2 today" "I'm the respiratory aide specialist" "I'm the nutritionist" "I'm the hospitalist") is exhausting. And the longer or more frequently a family is in the hospital, the more exhausting and frustrating that becomes. I saw one hospital that had each person give the patient or family a business card with his or her title and photo. They also provided an album (which was kind of hilarious that an album was needed but also highlights the point of just how many people come through a patient's room) in which the patient could put the card collection. This was helpful to be able to refer back to the cards to know who the person was that said "X" earlier in the day. But somehow easing this "interaction burden" would be helpful.
Posts.Title: How should we improve hospitals?

Posts.Title: Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - Tuesday, Feb. 5 @ 5pm PT/

Posts.Content: Please join us this Tuesday night in our advanced cancer caregivers virtual support - especially those of you we have not heard from for a while. How are you faring - let us know ... ? If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have both lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. Answer Cancer's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 p.m. Eastern time on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month. (Please note that only the month of January is an exception to this. After the January 8 meeting, our next meeting will be on January 22. Then we will return to the first and third Tuesdays.) Groups are FREE & DROP-IN; join online or by telephone - you can find the instructions for joining at the end of the message. AnCan's caregiver meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! Whilst free & drop-in, we do encourage you to make a tax-deductible donation; or, at a minimum, sign up to donate to Answer Cancer Foundation when you shop on Amazon. You can sign up here Amazon Smile - it costs you nothing! We hope to talk with you soon; please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org.
